summary: Lots of enb presets issue too many blooms, DOFs, granularities, blur lens, gloomy tastes or dark souls, which disturb the playing process greatly, although those enb creators consider them as artistic styles. In contrast to those art works, this enb focuses on clear, lucid and vivid graphics intenting to permeate the players with the game story and
descriptionHtml:
[color=#ff0000][size=4]ACKNOWLEDGE: SPEACIAL THANKS TO [/size][/color][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/663989/?][color=#ff0000][color=#1e84cc][size=4]Bronze316[/size][/color][/color][/url][color=#ff0000][size=4] and his masterpiece [/size][/color][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/20781/?][color=#ff0000][color=#1e84cc][size=4]Project ENB[/size][/color][/color][/url][size=4][color=#ff0000]. That's the base of this work.[/color]

[b]INTRODUCTION:[/b]

[/size][size=4]Project ENB is my favourite enb, which offers beautiful and the most lore-friendly graphics to help the players enjoy the game. Project ENB, however, ceased at the ENBSeries v0.221, and Bronze316 continued his work with Seasons of Skyrim ENB and True Vision ENB. I have to convey that I cannot like Seasons of Skyrim ENB and True Vision ENB such as Project ENB...In other words, I dislike them...

Finally I tried to adjust a enb with newer ENBSeries to myself taste, based on Project ENB. It's a boring and time consuming work, around 100 hours wasted, resulting in an utterly different enb in comparison with Project ENB.

It may not as good as Project ENB, but it has its own spirit anyway.The background of this enb has a tinge green, or pale blue-green to some extent. Hence I named it as Jadeite ENB.


[b]COMPATIBLITY:
[/b]
It was tweaked under the condition of [/size][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/17802/?http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/17802/?][size=4]Climates Of Tamriel[/size][/url][size=4] (COT) and [/size][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27043/?][size=4]Enhanced Lights and FX[/size][/url][size=4] (ELFX) or [/size][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/30450/?][size=4]Realistic Lighting Overhaul[/size][/url][size=4] (RLO).

It works well with vanilla weather and lighting.

It may work in other weathers, since I did not plug any extreme value into the enb. (Things may get weird under a few circumstanes, I am not sure. You may tweak it by youself. Here is a guide to help -Â  [/size][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/39742/?][size=4]Guide to ENBSeries - Teaching you how to tweak ENB[/size][/url][size=4] by --JawZ-- )


[b]INSTALLATION:[/b]

1) Download: [/size][url=http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0262.htm][size=4]0.262[/size][/url][size=4]binary ([/size][url=http://enbdev.com/enbseries_skyrim_v0262.zip
][size=4]enbseries_skyrim_v0262.zip[/size][/url][size=4]) and extract it somewhere.

2) Copy d3d9.dll and enbhost.exe from the wrapper folder to your Skyrim folder. (Where the SkyrimLauncher is located)

3) Download my enb preset and extract all the files into the same location. (Where the SkyrimLauncher is located)

4) Enjoy the game...


[color=#ff0000][b]UPDATE: A pseudo-fantasy version added.
[/b][/color]
Major parameters were revised. A few dark warm colors blended into background; more sharpening, lighting and shadow in the daytime, and a bit darker at night or in the dungeon.

It's style definitely deviates from the Project ENB. Also for 0.262 binaries.


[/size][center][size=4]
